p: Using mechanistic models ahead of field studies can improve the reliability of data collection. Craft et al. ( 2009) built a network model based on data describing the social interactions among Serengeti lions, and used it to run simulations of disease outbreaks. They quantified the impact of several properties of the empirically derived network on the outcome of the simulations, and highlighted potential biases caused by the way data had been collected. Although this analysis was conducted on a post hoc basis, such advice can help with the design of future field studies.
